Package launchpad_s_plus

Constitues the API used to input and output to the Launchpad S+

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Calculate
    This class is used:
    - to obtain the X or Y position of a pad based on its MIDI note value
    - to obtain the MIDI note value of a pad based on its X and Y positions
    - to return a random integer based on a min and max values
    Colors
    This class contains the Launchpad S specific MIDI velocity values used for output.
    DefaultMIDI
    Contains the simplified methods needed to send Virtual MIDI messages
    Display
    This class is used to turn on or off pads on the launchpad
    Methods available for use include:
    - a way to turn on a pad permanently (until overwritten),
    - a way to turn on a pad for a certain amount of time (in ms)
    - a way to turn on a pad for a certain duration (in ms) and change it to another color permanently afterwards
    - a way to turn off a pad
    - a way to start blinking a pad based on timing (in ms)
    - a way to start blinking a pad with 2 colors
    - a way to start blinking a pad with 3 colors
    - a way to stop blinking a pad
    - a way to turn off anything that might be on or blinking.
    DisplayBlink
    Class used by Display.java to start blinking lights.
    DisplayDevices
    This class is used to display available MIDI devices on the console
    DisplayPad
    Class used by Display.java to turn on or off a pad.
    Input
    Class used to determine input from the Launchpad S
    Launchpad
    Determines the connections to the Launchpad S.
    Padmap
    Creates a pad map continaing the values needed to determine positions of the Launchpad S pads
    PlaySound
    Implements a way to play sound samples located in the resources folder.
    Program
    Program initiation and termination
    ReceiveMidiMessage
    This class is used to notify all observers that an input has been received.
    SetMidiMessage
    Class used to set and send the MIDI Messages to the Launchpad S.
    SetupProcess
    Sets up the connection to the Launchpad S and to the internal virtual MIDI
    testGame
    This was simply used to show all possible colors available on the board.
    testLaunchpadOutput
    This simply calls an animation.
    VirtualMIDI
    Contains the simplified methods needed to send Virtual MIDI messages

Package launchpad_s_plus Description

Constitues the API used to input and output to the Launchpad S+
